subject: Programming
title: Technical Excellence as a Habit
description: A quick win: understand Technical Excellence as a Habit.

hook.text: Nobody plans to write bad code. It happens one small compromise at a time.

buildup.text: Clean code is a discipline, not a talent. It requires deliberate practice every single day.

discovery.text: The Software Craftsmanship movement treats programming as a skill to be honed, not just a job.

twist.text: Perfection isn't the goal. Continuous improvement is. Today's code should be better than yesterday's.

climax.text: The best codebases aren't written by geniuses. They're maintained by teams that care consistently.

punchline.text: Excellence isn't an act. It's a daily habit.

quiz.question: What does the Software Craftsmanship movement emphasize?
options: Treating programming as a skill to be honed
Writing code as fast as possible
